identificationModule.briefTitle: Normobaric Hyperoxia Combined With Endovascular Treatment for Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Normobaric Hyperoxia Combined With Endovascular Treatment for Acute Ischemic Stroke Patients Within 6-24 Hours of Symptom Onset

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficiency of normobaric hyperoxia combined with endovascular treatment for acute ischemic stroke patients with stroke onset 6-24 hours.

armGroups.label: NBO+EVT group
armGroups.description: Normobaric hyperoxia Combined with Endovascular therapy group were given 100% oxygen via a face mask initiated before vascular recanalization (10L/min for 4h) . In addition, the patient will be given endovascular therapy surgery.

armGroups.label: EVT group
armGroups.description: The Endovascular therapy group were given room air. And the patient will also be given endovascular therapy surgery.

interventions.name: Normobaric oxygen therapy
interventions.description: it is simple to administer via oxygen storage facemask at flow rates of 10 L/min for 4 hours.This therapy should begin in the emergency room as early as possible when patients meet the inclusion criteria and are randomized to the experimental group

primaryOutcomes.description: ENI was defined as percent change NIHSS≥30%; Percent change NIHSS was defined as \[(admission NIHSS score-24-hour NIHSS score)x100/admission NIHSS score\];

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale(NIHSS) Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: the NIHSS is a stroke severity score that is composed of 11 items; range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 hours ± 15 minutes, 24 ± 12 hours; 7 ± 2 days after randomization

secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the mRs is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0 = no symptoms to 5 = severe disability, and 6 = death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score from baseline to 24 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the NIHSS is a stroke severity score composed of 11 items (range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits)
secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the BI is an ordinal disability score of 10 categories(range from 0 to 100, higher values indicate better prognosis);
secondary imaging efficacy endpoint;Successful recanalization was defined as mTICI 2b or 3
NIHSS score increased by more than 4 points);the NIHSS is a stroke severity score composed of 11 items (range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits);clinical safety endpoint;
imaging safety endpoints;Deterioration in NIHSS score of ≥4 points within 24 hours;per ECASS III definition and per Heidelberg bleeding classification

secondary clinical efficacy endpoint, Quality of Life score; The descriptive system comprises five dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems and extreme problems. The patient is asked to indicate his/her health state by ticking the box next to the most appropriate statement in each of the five dimensions. This decision results in a 1-digit number that expresses the level selected for that dimension. The digits for the five dimensions can be combined into a 5-digit number that describes the patient's health state.
Delta NIHSS was defined (admission NIHSS score-24-hour NIHSS score).
Percent change NIHSS was defined as \[(admission NIHSS score-24-hour NIHSS score)x100/admission NIHSS score\]
Infarct volume is evaluated mainly through brain MRI(DWI) or CT

overallOfficials.name: Xunming Ji, MD
